title: For $1 Million, Donors to U.S.A. Birthday Group Offered Access to Trump
summary: A new organization blessed by the president is raising money for events and projects that will put a Trumpian spin on the nation’s semiquincentennial.

title: Reaction to Trump’s Racist Post Shows He Is Not Always Immune to Politics
summary: With the midterm elections nearing, President Trump has found himself in the uncomfortable position of backtracking, even if only by degrees, at key moments.

title: Demanding Support for Trump, Justice Dept. Struggles to Recruit Prosecutors
summary: Some offices are so decimated that the Justice Department has sent in military lawyers. More recently, officials asked for volunteers from other offices who can quickly deploy to places in desperate need.

title: Epstein Files Reveal Scope of Ghislaine Maxwell’s Role in Clinton Circle
summary: Jeffrey Epstein’s longtime companion helped advise on the kickoff of the Clinton Global Initiative and arranged for $1 million in funding for it, emails show.

title: Starmer’s Chief of Staff Resigns, Citing Role in Hiring Friend of Epstein
summary: The Labour official was ensnared in a scandal after helping appoint Peter Mandelson as Britain’s ambassador to the U.S.

title: 7 Days, No Suspects: The Disappearance of Nancy Guthrie
summary: The mother of the “Today” show host Savannah Guthrie has not been heard from since an evening of dinner and games with family members.

title: Bad Bunny’s Key Career Moments
summary: He’s had big hits, won awards, co-starred with Adam Sandler and even came out on top at WrestleMania. Here’s how the 31-year-old star got to music’s biggest stage.

title: At the Super Bowl, it’s Nice Guy vs. Underdog.
summary: Your guide to today’s matchup.

title: The 2026 Super Bowl Ads (So Far), Ranked
summary: Here is our critic’s survey of this year’s Super Bowl commercials, from best to worst to A.I.

title: Is Wallace Shawn the Only Avant-Garde Artist Who Gets Stopped in Times Square?
summary: He’s most commonly recognized for his screen roles as a plotting hit man and an unlikely Lothario, but it’s his work as a playwright that shows more of his true self.

title: Extreme Cold Persists in the Northeast With Record-Setting Temperatures
summary: Punishing winds have combined with low temperatures to produce dangerously cold conditions across the Northeast. Forecasters say, though, that relief is on the horizon.

title: What’s Behind the Weird Weather That’s Dominated 2026
summary: While iguanas were stunned by freezing cold in Florida, would-be skiers were looking at dirt on Utah’s slopes. Here’s what’s going on, and when it will finally end.

title: Seven Pages of a Sealed Watergate File Sat Undiscovered. Until Now.
summary: Seven pages of grand jury testimony from Richard Nixon were deemed so incendiary that they were hidden from the public for years.

title: The Aftermath of Feeding America’s Credibility Into the Woodchipper
summary: The brutality of U.S.A.I.D.’s closure and the disregard for the human toll betrayed a vision of a crueler, meaner, more insular world.

title: Talk to Your Parents
summary: Today, some advice on having conversations with aging parents about their health.

title: Studying Antarctica’s Ice From the Side of a Helicopter
summary: The fastest way into the gaps between gigantic blocks of a broken-up glacier is by lowering instruments from above, through the door of a helicopter.

title: A First Look Below Antarctica’s Most Menacing Glacier
summary: Scientists on the Thwaites Glacier attempted to install equipment beneath the ice to better understand how it is melting. Our climate reporter Raymond Zhong walks us through their landmark experiment and the bittersweet outcome.

title: Japan’s Sanae Takaichi Wins Snap Election in a Landslide
summary: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi won a sweeping mandate from voters for her economic agenda and tough stances on immigration and China.

title: Washington Post C.E.O. Will Lewis Steps Down After Stormy Tenure
summary: His departure came days after the company cut 30 percent of the staff. He will be replaced in the interim by Jeff D’Onofrio, the chief financial officer, the company said.

title: Portugal Votes for President, With Leftist Set to Beat Surging Far Right
summary: Polls predict a comfortable victory for António José Seguro, but a nationalist’s presence in the runoff showed that Portugal is not immune to Europe’s rising nationalist tide.

title: In Bid to Lead Thailand, a Progressive Party Softens Its Image
summary: Sunday’s election is a test for the progressive, pro-democracy movement in Thailand, which has been blocked from taking power despite success at the polls.
